Generation VIII.Sword: The swirl pattern in this Pokémon's body is its weakness. If it gets stirred, the swirl loses its shape, and Sinistea gets dizzy.
Generation VIII.Shield: It absorbs the life-force of those who drink it. It waits patiently, but opportunities are fleeting—it tastes so bad that it gets spat out immediately.

Generation IX.Scarlet: Some fanatics will go to great pains to prepare the perfect tea and teacup, eagerly waiting for a Sinistea to come and possess their selections.
Generation IX.Violet: This Sinistea lives in an antique teacup. As valuable as this Pokémon is, its awful taste remains unchanged.
